body:
Comment 6 by **hugo.vincent**: 
> and to be really useful you would want to be able to
> define the channel type

Surely, the obvious type would be the functions return type?

> The gain, as I see it, is that you don't need the goroutine
> to be go aware. You can "go" any function, anywhere,
> anyhow =) And when it's done, the result is waiting for
> you in the channel.

Yes, exactly. +1 for this proposal!
